Sure, here are some more recent and exciting facts about soap operas:

- The popular soap opera, The Young and The Restless, became the first American daytime drama to resume production amid the COVID-19 pandemic, with safety measures in place for the cast and crew.

- The long-running Australian soap opera, Neighbours, made history in 2018 when it featured the first same-sex wedding in Australian television history, following the legalization of same-sex marriage in the country.

- In 2020, the daytime soap opera, Days of Our Lives, featured an entire storyline involving the coronavirus pandemic, with characters dealing with masks, lockdowns, and other pandemic-related issues.

- The popular streaming platform, Netflix, has started producing original soap operas, such as the Spanish series, Elite, and the Brazilian series, Coisa Mais Linda, which have gained international popularity.

- The primetime soap opera, Empire, premiered in 2015 and broke records as FOX's highest-rated debut series in three years. It focused on the rise of the Lyon family in the music industry and tackled socially relevant issues like homophobia, racism, and mental health.
